p: 1. Review of §§ 15-17. The task of § 18. A review of the foregoing:
• I meet tools within a world of praxis.
• The being of tools is their usefulness, which has an ontological relation to that world and to its structure.
• That world is always operative and in fact has already be disclosed, even if only unthematically.¶
• The meaning-giving world can “light up” when tools are damaged, missing, or in the way.
In the present section we will deal with the following questions:
• How does the world of praxis let us encounter something as a tool?
• What does it mean to say that tools get “freed up beforehand” for our concern and foresight?
• How does the world of meaning affect the being of tools?
• Most importantly: What is the essential structure of such worlds of meaning?
